A

AbstractAccessToken<IDType> - Class in org.jtrim.access
A convenient base class for AccessToken implementations.
AbstractAccessToken() - Constructor for class org.jtrim.access.AbstractAccessToken
Initializes the AbstractAccessToken.
AccessAvailabilityNotifier<RightType> - Class in org.jtrim.access
Deprecated.
Use boolean properties instead with AutoDisplayState.

An AccessAvailabilityNotifier can keep track of the availability of group of rights and notify listeners when a change occurs. The AccessAvailabilityNotifier must be create by the static attach method and the newly created instance will then keep track of the changes of the rights of the passed AccessManager.

Once you have created an instance of AccessAvailabilityNotifier, you may then specify group of rights and action to executed when the availability of these rights changes. That is, if they all become available, or if they cannot be acquired due to one or more rights being unavailable.

Thread safety

Instances of AccessAvailabilityNotifier are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent but they do not wait for any external event. That is, they return relatively quickly.
AccessChangeAction - Interface in org.jtrim.access
Deprecated.
This interface was designed for AccessAvailabilityNotifier which is deprecated.

The listener interface to be invoked when the availability of a right group changes. That is, when a group of rights become available or unavailable in an AccessManager.

AccessChangeAction implementations are intended to be added to an AccessAvailabilityNotifier.

Thread safety

Most implementation of this interface are not required to be thread-safe but AccessManager managing the rights, may define otherwise.

Synchronization transparency

Implementations of this listener are not required to be synchronization transparent however they must not wait for asynchronous events.

AffineImageTransformer - Class in org.jtrim.image.transform
Deprecated.
Use AffineTransformationStep instead. Defines an ImageTransformer transforming an image based on an affine transformation.

This AffineImageTransformer defines the offset so, that (0, 0) offset means that the center of the source image will be transformed to the center of the destination image.

Thread safety

Instances of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent and calling them while holding a lock should be avoided.

AsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddress> - Class in org.jtrim.swing.component
Deprecated.
This class is very inefficient, use TransformedImageDisplay instead. Defines a Swing component which is able to display an image applying a series of user defined transformations.

There are three kind of properties you need to specify for this component:

  • The address of the image to be displayed. The address will be specified for the query used to retrieve the image. So the address can be any type, for example: java.net.URI. The address can be set by calling the setImageAddress method.
  • The AsyncDataQuery used to retrieve the image. The image is retrieved by the address specified previously. The query can be set by calling one of the setImageQuery methods.
  • The transformations which will be used to transform the image retrieved by the image query. These transformations can be set by calling one of the setImageTransformer methods. Note that multiple transformations can be applied to a given image in any order.

Note that this component is an AsyncRenderingComponent and relies on an AsyncRenderer. Therefore it must be set before displaying this component, either by passing an AsyncRendererFactory to the appropriate constructor or by setting it later.

This class is highly experimental and may see significant changes in the future.

The thread-safety property of this component is the same as with any other Swing components. That is, instances of this class can be accessed only from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread after made displayable.

ButtonCancelSwitcher - Class in org.jtrim.swing.access
Deprecated.
You should rely on AutoDisplayState instead.

Defines an AccessChangeAction which sets the caption of a JButton depending on the availability of the associated group of rights.

The intended use of the ButtonCancelSwitcher is to set the cancel caption for the button when the given rights are not available (assuming that they are not available because of a task which maybe canceled).

Note that ButtonCancelSwitcher does call the setText method of the JButton instances in the onChangeAccess method, so the AccessManager governing the rights must be set to use an executor which submits tasks to the AWT event dispatch thread (or wrap the ComponentDisabler in an AccessChangeAction which makes sure that the onChangeAccess method does not get called on an inappropriate thread).

Thread safety

The onChangeAccess may only be called from the AWT event dispatch thread but other methods are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

ComponentDecorator - Class in org.jtrim.swing.access
Deprecated.
You should rely on AutoDisplayState instead.

Defines an AccessChangeAction implementation which decorates a Swing component if the associated group of right becomes unavailable. The component is required to be a JLayer or top level window having a root pane.

The ComponentDecorator decorates the component using its glass pane. That is, when the associated group of rights becomes unavailable, it will replace the glass pane of the components with the one provided to the ComponentDecorator at construction time (by a factory class).

When you expect that usually the group of right is only unavailable for a very short period of time, it is possible to define a two kinds of decorations ComponentDecorator. One to apply immediately after the group of rights becomes unavailable and one after a specified time elapses and the group of rights is still unavailable. This is useful to prevent flickering if the group of rights becomes available within the specified time (that is, if the glass pane set up immediately does not have a visual effect).

Note that if the glass pane which is to be set by the ComponentDecorator can have the focus (as defined by the method Component.isFocusable()) and the component decorated by the ComponentDecorator has the focus (or one of its subcomponents), the focus will be moved to the newly set glass pane (if possible).

Thread safety

The onChangeAccess may only be called from the AWT event dispatch thread. Therefore, the AccessManager governing the rights must be set to use an executor which submits tasks to the AWT event dispatch thread (or wrap the ComponentDecorator in an AccessChangeAction which makes sure that the onChangeAccess method does not get called on an inappropriate thread).

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.
ComponentDecorator(RootPaneContainer, DecoratorPanelFactory) - Constructor for class org.jtrim.swing.access.ComponentDecorator
Deprecated.
Creates a new ComponentDecorator decorating a window.

ComponentDisabler - Class in org.jtrim.swing.access
Deprecated.
You should rely on AutoDisplayState instead.

Defines an AccessChangeAction which disables or enables the AWT components specified at construction time according to the availability of the associated group of rights.

Note that ComponentDisabler does call the setEnabled method of the components in the onChangeAccess method, so the AccessManager governing the rights must be set to use an executor which submits tasks to the AWT event dispatch thread (or wrap the ComponentDisabler in an AccessChangeAction which makes sure that the onChangeAccess method does not get called on an inappropriate thread).

Thread safety

The onChangeAccess may only be called from the AWT event dispatch thread but other methods are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

D

DataRenderer<DataType> - Interface in org.jtrim.swing.concurrent.async
Defines an arbitrary rendering task.
DecoratorPanelFactory - Interface in org.jtrim.swing.access
Deprecated.
You should rely on AutoDisplayState instead.

Defines an interface creating JPanel instances for the ComponentDecorator. The JPanel instances created by this DecoratorPanelFactory are to be used as a glass pane for Swing components (those that have glass pane).

The ComponentDecorator needs to create JPanel instances when the group of rights associated with it becomes unavailable.

Thread safety

Implementations of this interface can only be used from the AWT event dispatch thread (unless they allow otherwise).

Synchronization transparency

Implementations of this interface are not required to be synchronization transparent but due to being used on the AWT event dispatch thread they must avoid expensive actions.
DelayedDecorator - Class in org.jtrim.swing.access
Deprecated.
You should rely on AutoDisplayState instead.

Defines the JPanel factories required for the ComponentDecorator. These panels are used as the glass pane of the component managed by the ComponentDecorator.

There are two panel factories used by ComponentDecorator: One is to be immediately installed when the group of rights associated with the ComponentDecorator becomes unavailable and one to be installed after a certain time elapses and the rights are still unavailable.

Thread safety

Methods of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently. Not however that this is not true for the DecoratorPanelFactory instances.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

ImageData - Class in org.jtrim.image
Deprecated.
Use ImageResult instead. Defines an image which was retrieved from an external source. Apart from the image itself, the ImageData contains the meta data information of the image and an exception associated with the image retrieval.

Although it is possible to mutate the properties of an ImageData instance, the intended use of ImageData is to use it as an effectively immutable object. That is, its properties should not be modified (e.g.: The pixels of the BufferedImage should not be modified).

This class implements the MemoryHeavyObject interface and approximates the size of an ImageData instance by the approximate size of the underlying BufferedImage.

Note that this class also provides several useful static helper methods, to create BufferedImage instance better handled by the Java and methods to calculate the approximate size of a BufferedImage.

Thread safety

Methods of this class can be safely accessed by multiple threads. Although individual properties are not immutable, they should treated so. Users of this class can assume that the properties of ImageData are not modified and can be safely accessed by multiple concurrent threads as well.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
ImageData(BufferedImage, ImageMetaData, ImageReceiveException) - Constructor for class org.jtrim.image.ImageData
Deprecated.
Initializes the ImageData with the given image, meta data and exception describing the failure in retrieving the image.
ImageListener - Interface in org.jtrim.swing.component
Deprecated.
This interface is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this interface. The interface for the listeners which are to be notified by the AsyncImageDisplay when its underlying image changes or successfully receives the meta-data of the image.

Thread safety

Instances of this listener interface can only be notified from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread and therefore does not need to be thread-safe.

Synchronization transparency

Implementations of this interface does not need to be synchronization transparent but they must be aware that they are called from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread.

ImageTransformationStep - Interface in org.jtrim.image.transform
Defines an element of a series of transformation applied to an image.
ImageTransformer - Interface in org.jtrim.image.transform
Deprecated.
Use ImageTransformationStep instead. Defines an image transformation from ImageTransformerData to TransformedImage.

When applying a transformation on the input, the conversion must specify the coordinate transformation which transforms the coordinates of the source image to the coordinates of the resulting image. That is, where a pixel of the original image can be found on the resulting image. The coordinate transformation must support coordinates laying outside the bounds of the image.

Thread safety

Implementations of this interface are required to be safe to be used by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Implementations of this interface are not required to be synchronization transparent.
ImageTransformerData - Class in org.jtrim.image.transform
Deprecated.
This class is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this class. Defines the input of an image transformer.

Thread safety

Methods of this class can be safely accessed by multiple threads. Although individual properties are not immutable, they should be treated so. Users of this class can assume that the properties of ImageTransformerData are not modified and can be safely accessed by multiple concurrent threads as well.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

Deprecated.
Creates a new ImageTransformerData with the specified properties.
ImageTransformerLink - Class in org.jtrim.image.transform
Deprecated.
This class is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this class. Defines an AsyncDataLink which transforms an image on the specified TaskExecutorService. There can be multiple transformations defined, each defining a more and more accurate transformation. That is, ImageTransformerLink applies each transformation to its input and forwards each transformed image assuming that the last transformation applied is the most accurate one.

Note that essentially each transformation defines the same transformation, they should only differ in the accuracy of their result.

This class works similar to the AsyncDataLink instances created by the AsyncLinks.convertGradually method. The only difference is that ImageTransformerLink will convert the result of the transformation (TransformedImage) to TransformedImageData.

Thread safety

The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.
ImageTransformerLink(ImageTransformerData, TaskExecutorService, ImageTransformer...) - Constructor for class org.jtrim.image.transform.ImageTransformerLink
Deprecated.
Creates a new ImageTransformerLink which will execute the image transformations on the specified TaskExecutorService.
ImageTransformerLink(ImageTransformerData, List<AsyncDataConverter<ImageTransformerData, TransformedImage>>) - Constructor for class org.jtrim.image.transform.ImageTransformerLink
Deprecated.
Creates a new ImageTransformerLink applying the specified image transformations on the input image.
ImageTransformerQuery - Class in org.jtrim.image.transform
Deprecated.
This class is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this class. Defines an AsyncDataQuery which transforms its input image on the specified TaskExecutorService. There can be multiple transformations defined, each defining a more and more accurate transformation. That is, ImageTransformerLink applies each transformation to its input and forwards each transformed image assuming that the last transformation applied is the most accurate one.

Note that essentially each transformation defines the same transformation, they should only differ in the accuracy of their result.

This class is effectively a factory for ImageTransformerLink instances. That is, the createDataLink method creates an ImageTransformerLink with the arguments specified at construction time.

Thread safety

The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

RequestGrabber - Class in org.jtrim.access
Deprecated.
Use boolean properties instead of hacking with this class.

Allows to acquire and release a specific AccessRequest from an AccessManager. The request and the access manager is specified at construction time and may not be changed later.

Once an instance of RequestGrabber was created, the acquire() method can be used to acquire the right and disallow requests conflicting the request of the RequestGrabber to be granted to anyone until release() is called.

Thread safety

Methods of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are not synchronization transparent. Note however, that both the acquire() and release() method returns without blocking and waiting for external events. That is, they can be called from threads which must not be blocked (e.g.: the AWT event dispatch thread).
RequestGrabber(AccessManager<IDType, RightType>, AccessRequest<? extends IDType, ? extends RightType>) - Constructor for class org.jtrim.access.RequestGrabber
Deprecated.
Creates a RequestGrabber which will use the specified AccessManager to aquire the specified AccessRequest.

SimpleAsyncImageDisplay<ImageAddressType> - Class in org.jtrim.swing.component
Deprecated.
This class is very inefficient, use BasicTransformedImageDisplay instead. Defines a Swing component which is able to display an image, applying a series of user defined transformations and convenience methods to apply basic image transformations. This component supports every transformation of the BasicTransformationModel. These basic transformations are applied on transformation index: 0. Other transformations might be applied before and after these transformations by calling any of the setImageTransformer method with the appropriate transformation index.

Additionally this component is able to display the image using various interpolations and even using multiple interpolations at once. If multiple interpolations are used, they will be used to render the image in the requested order. This can be beneficial when using a fast interpolation first and a slow but better interpolation last. With this settings when rapidly changing the transformation properties of this component, the fast interpolation will be displayed to the user while it calculates the better interpolated image.

This component defines the offset of the image so that if it is (0.0, 0.0), the center of the image will be in the center of the component.

Note: You should set the TaskExecutorService used to render the image by calling setDefaultExecutor. You may also use different TaskExecutorService instances for different interpolation types by calling the setExecutor method. Using distinct executors for different interpolation type is advantageous in most cases because it prevents slow interpolations from blocking fast interpolations.

About other properties of this component see the description of AsyncImageDisplay.

The thread-safety property of this component is the same as with any other Swing components. That is, instances of this class can be accessed only from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread after made displayable.

SimpleAsyncImageDisplay() - Constructor for class org.jtrim.swing.component.SimpleAsyncImageDisplay
Deprecated.
Creates a SimpleAsyncImageDisplay with identity transformation applying bilinear transformations (the interpolation type only matters if the transformation is changed to something else than identity).
SimpleAsyncImageDisplay(AsyncRendererFactory) - Constructor for class org.jtrim.swing.component.SimpleAsyncImageDisplay
Deprecated.
Creates a SimpleAsyncImageDisplay with identity transformation applying bilinear transformations (the interpolation type only matters if the transformation is changed to something else than identity).
SimpleUriImageLink - Class in org.jtrim.image.async
Deprecated.
Use InputStreamImageLink instead or create a data link via UriImageIOQuery. Defines an AsyncDataLink which is able to retrieve an image based on an URI. To actually retrieve the image file from the external source, the URL class is used, therefore SimpleUriImageLink is able to retrieve any image which the URL class can. To load the image, the ImageIO library of Java is used and therefore the meta data of the retrieved image is a JavaIIOMetaData.

The SimpleUriImageLink is able to retrieve partially retrieved image and even the meta data without the image until the complete image is available.

Thread safety

The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.
SimpleUriImageLink(URI, TaskExecutor, long) - Constructor for class org.jtrim.image.async.SimpleUriImageLink
Deprecated.
Creates the SimpleUriImageLink with the specified URI defining the image to be retrieved.
SimpleUriImageQuery - Class in org.jtrim.image.async
Deprecated.
Use UriImageIOQuery instead. Defines an AsyncDataQuery which is able to retrieve images based on an URI. The URI is specified as an input for the query. To actually retrieve the image file from the external source, the URL class is used, therefore SimpleUriImageLink is able to retrieve any image which the URL class can. To load the image, the ImageIO library of Java is used and therefore the meta data of the retrieved image is a JavaIIOMetaData.

This implementation completely relies on the SimpleUriImageLink to retrieve images.

Thread safety

The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

TransformedImageData - Class in org.jtrim.image.transform
Deprecated.
This class is only used by deprecated classes. There is no replacement for this class. Defines the output of an ImageTransformerLink.

Thread safety

Methods of this class can be safely accessed by multiple threads. Although individual properties are not immutable, they should be treated so. Users of this class can assume that the properties of ImageTransformerData are not modified and can be safely accessed by multiple concurrent threads as well.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

zoomToFit() - Method in class org.jtrim.swing.component.BasicTransformationProperty
Returns the zoomToFitOptions property of the underlying BasicTransformationModel.
ZoomToFitOption - Enum in org.jtrim.image.transform
Defines the possible rules which should be applied when scaling an image to fit a particular display.
ZoomToFitTransformationStep - Class in org.jtrim.image.transform
Defines an ImageTransformationStep scaling the input image to fit the display.
ZoomToFitTransformationStep(BasicImageTransformations, Set<ZoomToFitOption>, Color, InterpolationType) - Constructor for class org.jtrim.image.transform.ZoomToFitTransformationStep
Creates a new ZoomToFitTransformationStep with the specified properties.
ZoomToFitTransformer - Class in org.jtrim.image.transform
Deprecated.
Use ZoomToFitTransformationStep instead. Defines an ImageTransformer scaling an image to fit the display.

Special cases:

  • If neither FIT_WIDTH, nor FIT_HEIGHT is specified, then the image is not scaled (i.e., the applied zoom property is 1.0).
  • If exactly one of FIT_WIDTH and FIT_HEIGHT is specified, then the aspect ratio is honored unless the absence of MAY_MAGNIFY requires that the applied zoomX or zoomY must not exceed 1.0.
  • If MAY_MAGNIFY is not specified, then neither the applied zoomX, nor the zoomY can be greater than 1.0. They will be reduced accordingly (if KEEP_ASPECT_RATIO is not set, then only the offending one will be reduced to 1.0).

Thread safety

Instances of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent and calling them while holding a lock should be avoided.
